question: 2-Methyl propane can be prepared by Wurtz reaction. The haloalkanes taken along with metallic sodium and dry ether are:
explanation: Wurtz reaction couples two alkyl groups. To form 2-methylpropane (isobutane, <katex>$(CH_3)_2CH-CH_3$</katex>), one needs a methyl group (<katex>$CH_3-$</katex>) and an isopropyl group (<katex>$(CH_3)_2CH-$</katex>). Thus, chloromethane and 2-chloropropane are required.
